reviews.negative_text:
A fuir, du jamais vu!!
Nous avons réservé 2 nuits pour 2 adultes dans cet hôtel le week-end du 14 juillet.
Nous avons 1 bébé de 3 mois et un autre de 2 ans et demi et nous avions vérifié dans les conditions de l’hôtel que c’était bien ok. « Tous les enfants sont les bienvenus, lit d’appoint sur demande ». Nous n’en n’avions pas besoin car nous en avons un. Jusqu’ici rien d’inhabituel, nous sommes habituées des hôtels. Nous arrivons tardivement la première nuit, nos clés nous attendent. En descendant le lendemain matin, la responsable à la réception nous interpelle car nous avons deux enfants et que ce n’est tout simplement pas possible dans notre chambre. Aucun problème pour nous, s’il faut payer un supplément nous le ferons même si nous ne comprenons pas forcément le souci aux vues des conditions de l’hôtel. Mais il n’en est rien, nous avons été jetées dehors sans remboursement un week-end de 14 juillet où tout est complet. Ça ne pose aucun problème à ce couple de gérant de laisser un bébé de 3 mois et un autre de 2 ans dormir dans une voiture. La revente d’une nuit d’hôtel à prix fort est bien plus attrayant !
Vous répondrez bien évidemment comme sur Google en nuançant fortement tout cela, pour essayer de passer pour des gens bienveillants. Le fait est que nous avons bel et bien été jetées dehors avec 2 enfants en bas âge sans aucun état d’âme et un petit sourire en coin. Booking n’a pas grand chose à voir avec cela, c’est un peu facile de se cacher derrière cette excuse. 
Nous avons relaté les faits aux bonnes personnes, ce qui a choqué absolument tout le monde…..

reviews.review_title: Une belle étape sur l'autoroute des oiseaux
reviews.positive_text:
Une bien jolie ville, Chatelaillon-la-plage, avec l'hôtel Victoria et son manager Emmanuel, nous accueillent. dans l'après-midi. Le cadre est magnifique dans cette rue arborée et dès l'entrée on découvre un salon extérieur pour se poser après la route. Sourires bienveillants et conseils sur les activités alentours nous ont permis de visiter l'église qui est décorée par un graffeur avec goût et talent. Un passage aux Francofolies avant de rejoindre l'hôtel Victoria et la chambre pour la nuit. L'endroit est cosy et le repos garanti dans ce bel établissement !
Au matin, un petit déjeuner complet et copieux nous ravit les papilles avant de poursuivre la route. Amabilité de Maelle qui assure ce service du matin et remerciements à nos hôtes Emmanuel et Salima et c'est déjà le départ.
Un grand merci pour ce moment hors du temps dans cette jolie ville de Chatelaillon !

Character property in great location, opposite the train station which was ideal for getting around - 10 minutes by train into La Rochelle. Short flat walk of just over 5 minutes through the park to the beach, bars and restaurants. Lovely refined resort. Hotel has no lift, not a problem for us. We didn't take the option of breakfast so can't comment on that. We were in room 240 at the top of hotel. Very nice suite with a very large double and a separate single room. Very nice bathroom, powerful shower. Staff very friendly and helpful. Easy to find, we were able to park on site for free but there's plenty of parking in the street.

reviews.review_title: Very peaceful clean and comfortable B n B in ideal location
reviews.positive_text:
Delightfully peaceful and welcoming family hotel  with onsite private parking.  The communal areas inside have a  stylish yet comfortable/cosy  ambience and there is also a  spacious covered seating exterior area at the front.  This was our third visit in as many years.  The friendly owner recognised me and immediately spoke in English.  

Ideal location as within minutes walking distance of many shops, restaurants and the beach.
reviews.negative_text: One small thing, the pillows were a bit too thick and firm for us.  A spare second thinner pillow per person would be ideal.

reviews.review_title: A fabulous location and memorable stay for the right reasons.
reviews.positive_text: I love the story of the owners who have lovingly restored this hotel and now welcome each guest in such a personable manner. The rooms have been beautifully and extravagantly restored. The continental breakfast is excellently presented and of high quality as well as modestly priced. In fact, the cost of staying at this hotel is very reasonable and about 40% less than comparable hotels in Las Rochelle. The hotel is in the absolute ideal position in Châtalaillon, less than 200m from the very centre of the beach and the best restaurants, and through a park to reach it, while being across the road (25m) from the train station, which links with La Rochelle in about 10 minutes.
reviews.negative_text: Trains to La Rochelle are cheap and very comfortable even if not as frequent as they could be. The hotel's facilities are exactly as described. It would be better if tea/coffee making facilities were added in because the hotel's bar is not always open, but these are not advertised. However, currently most hotels in this category make this provision. An expectation that guests will hang room keys on public display while there is no safe in the room for valuables is an anachronism. It is one aspect of this being a hotel set in the French tradition, but sooner or later there will be a serious theft from a room or rooms by taking one or more keys at an unguarded moment and there will be tears to shed. It is a pity that the terrace which is advertised is in the front of the building, not the rear. None of these things robbed us in any way of an enjoyable and memorable stay.

The locality of this hotel was perfect, it was adjacent to the station, not that there was any train noise to notice. It was a main transport link between La Rochelle and Bordeaux. Also, a bus route was also available.
The beach was a 5 minute gentle stroll through a beautiful parc which led straight onto the esplanade which has a good variety of bars, restaurants and ice cream parlours and creperies.

Lovely boutique hotel with Victorian and modern decor, nice sized rooms and fantastic shower.

Good buffet breakfast with decent coffee and tea boite plus  a range of cold  meats cheeses, hard boiled egg, yogurts breads, cereals and fruit etc.
Free parking on street and very easy access. Lots of restaurants within walking distance at sea front, through a beautiful park.

Fabulous quiet, bespoke hotel close to the train station and easy walk to the beach. The owners have gone to great lengths to fill this beautiful building with charming art & furniture. Staff were friendly, attentive & quick to help us with recommendations & things to see.

We really enjoyed our stay here - we had tried to find a hotel in nearby La Rochelle, but settled on this one as there were none available. And next time, we will stay here instead of looking at La Rochelle. Chatelaillon-Plage is a lovely little resort, and the hotel is very close to the centre but still very quiet, with free car parking.
The staff on reception were delightful, we felt really welcome. Rooms are simple, but really clean and with excellent air conditioning. There’s a little bar on site, but no restaurant. The young lady on reception recommended several places to eat, and the one we chose was great!
